DataElement.preferredName: Patient Protein Urinalysis Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response related to patient's urine protein as a criteria in determining eligibility in medical care programs and services.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient's urine protein as a criteria in determining eligibility in medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism.:A test that determines the content of the urine.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.

Laboratory analysis of urine, commonly used to aid in the diagnosis of disease or to detect the presence of a specific substance. It involves examination of the urine by physical or chemical means as well as microscopic examination that helps to screen for urinary tract infections, renal disease, and diseases of other organs, that result in abnormal metabolites (break-down products) appearing in the urine.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study proteinuria less
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study proteinuria less than or equal to +1 on dipstick or less than or equal to 1 gram/24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than or equal to 1 on spot urinalysis or protein less than or equal to 500 mg/24 hour urine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than or equal to 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study proteinuria less than or equal to 1+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than week apart, or a urine protein:creatinine (UPC) ratio of less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than 1 or protein less than 1 g protein on 24 hour urine collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has urine protein been screened by urinalysis and if protein is greater than or equal to 2+, is 24-hour urine protein less than 1000 mg?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive urinalysis/dipstick tests taken no less than 1 week apart or if proteinuria is 2+ proteinuria on dipstick, does 24 hour urine collection demonstrate less than or equal to 500 mg over 24 hours OR Urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) of less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study proteinuria less than or equal to 1+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than a week apart, or a urine protein:creatinine (UPC) ratio of less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) less than or equal to 1 or less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart or if proteinuria is greater than or equal to 2+ on dipstick, does 24 hour urine collection demonstrate protein less than or equal to 500mg over 24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If urine protein is 2+ or higher, has 24 hour urine protein been obtained and determined to be greater than or equal to 1000 mg?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is urine protein:creatinine (UPC) ratio less than 1 or urine dipstick for proteinuria less than or equal to  2+ (note: if the UPC ratio is greater than or equal to 1 then a 24-hour urine collection should be performed and this must demonstrate less than or equal to 1g of protein in 24 hours)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre- study urinary protein (proteinuria) less than or equal to 1+ on dipstick or routine urinalysis, or a 24-hour urine collection for protein less than 1000 mg of protein in 24 hours?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) less than or equal to 1 on a random urine sample?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) less than or equal to 1 or less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart or if patient has proteinuria 2+ on dipstick, is UPC less than 0.5 on 2 consecutive samples?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have urine protein: creatinine ratio (UPC) of less than or equal to 1 OR less than or equal to 2 plus proteinuria  on two consecutive urinalysis/dipstick tests taken no less than 1 week apart within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have proteinuria greater than or equal to grade 3 as assessed by a 24hr protein quantification or estimated by urine protein:creatinine ratio greater than 3.5 on a random urine sample?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have urine protein:creatinine ratio (UPC) of less than or equal to 1 OR less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria  on two consecutive urinalysis/dipstick tests taken no less than 1 week apart within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study proteinuria less than or equal to 1+ on dipstick testing (if 2+ seen on first test, retest greater than or equal to 24 hours later)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have proteinuria estimated by urine protein/creatinine ratio greater than 3.5 g/g on a random urine sample or grade greater than or equal to 3 as assessed by 24-hour urine protein collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has 1+ or greater proteinuria on UA and a spot urine protein:creatinine ratio of greater than 0.5, is baseline proteinuria documented as greater than 1000 mg/day on 24-hour urine collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG-TEXT-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have proteinuria ≥30 mg/dL on random urine analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have proteinuria greater than or equal to 30 mg/dL on random urine analysis?
